interviews.title: Schaefer makes appearance on ‘Good Morning America’ after being drafted by Islanders
interviews.content: Schaefer makes appearance on ‘Good Morning America’ after being drafted by Islanders No. 1 pick discusses joining NHL on talk show © Good Morning America By Christopher Detwiler @Chris_Detwiler NHL.com Staff Writer June 29, 2025 Link copied Matthew Schaefer joined âGood Morning Americaâ on Sunday, just two days after he was selected No. 1 by the New York Islanders at the 2025 Upper Deck NHL Draft. The 17-year-old defenseman talked about the moment he heard his name called. âIt was awesome. It was amazing,â Schaefer said on the show. âLots of tears that day. Definitely got the best of me. To hear your name called is a dream come true and itâs every kidâs dream to get into the NHL. Itâs such an honor to be drafted by such a great organization.â Schaefer lost his mom, Jennifer, to breast cancer in February of 2024, and kept her close to his heart during the draft. He arrived at the draft in a suit with photos of his mother sewn on the inside, then, when he received his draft day jersey from the Islanders, the team had pinned a pink breast cancer ribbon on the sweater, along with his momâs initials. He showed the jersey to the hosts on the show. âIt means a lot,â he said. âItâs an honor when I get drafted by such a great team, but then they do that, it goes a long way.â It was an emotional moment for the teenager and his father, Todd, on one of the biggest stages. On the show, Schaefer discussed his dadâs role in his life. âHeâs always there for me and my brother, obviously though the tough times,â Schaefer said. âSo, to have him in my corner, and my brother, it helps a lot.â Schaefer also discussed his brief time on Long Island so far and expressed his excitement to join the team. After making a full recovery from his injury this season, Schaefer made it clear that he is more than ready to hit the ground â or ice â running. âIâve been through a lot in life, and that makes me stronger,â he said. âInjuries are really easy compared to a lot of other things. Itâs just a bump in the road. Just have to work as hard as you can to get back at it.â

interviews.title: Schaefer, Misa join 'NHL Draft Class' podcast
interviews.content: "podcast . Co-hosts Adam Kimelman and Mike G. Morreale were joined on the show by the first three selections, starting with defenseman Matthew Schaefer, who went No. 1 to the New York Islanders. Schaefer accepted his jersey from NHL Commissioner Gary Bettman, but it came with a bit of a surprise -- a ribbon in support of Schaefer's mother, Jennifer, who died from breast cancer in February 2024. Jennifer Schaefer's initials also were sewn into the collar of the jersey."
